poem:
Title: "A Class Apart"

Under the chalk of lessons wrote,
In the staffroom's strained discourse,
Unvoiced cries wax anecdote,
Sorrow's unseen source.

One in four drink deeper still, 
One in ten are danced on the brink.
Echoes loom in the schoolyard's thrill,
A lesson we dare not think.

In the pupil's eager glare,
Teachers teeter, crash, cascade.
Chalk becomes the cross they bear, 
Within the class, the crisis made.
